# Medical If someone finds themselves injured, Medical is tasked with bringing them to health.
## Personnel [color=#5b97bc]Medical[/color] primarily employs [color=cyan]Physicians[/color], [color=cyan]Paramedics[/color], and [color=cyan]Chemists[/color].
[color=#5b97bc]Medical[/color] care is directed by the [color=cyan]Chief Medical Officer.[/color]
## Physicians
[color=cyan]Physicians[/color] serve as the primary practicioner within the [color=#5b97bc]Medical[/color] ward, and are responsible for bringing patients to good health through medicine, and are expected to perform surgeries and other intensive care as necessary.
[textlink="Learn more about Physicians." link="OffbrandPhysicians"]
## Paramedics
[color=cyan]Paramedics[/color] serve as the primary medical first responder on stations, and are tasked with retrieving and stabilizing patients to bring them to the [color=#5b97bc]Medical[/color] department for [color=cyan]Physicians[/color] to treat. In states of emergencies, [color=cyan]Paramedics[/color] may be tasked with ensuring nobody dies in the [color=#5b97bc]Medical[/color] ward whilst the [color=cyan]Physicians[/color] work through surgeries.
[textlink="Learn more about Physicians." link="OffbrandParamedics"]
## Chemists
[color=cyan]Chemists[/color] are responsible for synthesizing the medications relied upon by the [color=cyan]Physicians[/color] and the [color=cyan]Paramedics[/color]. They also fill prescriptions for the crew, and can create non-medical chemicals in their laboratory, should the need arise.
[textlink="Learn more about Chemists." link="OffbrandChemists"]
